conversation.content: Wrong item. Again. Can't do this anymore.
Oh! Okay let me, um, pull up your account real quick... what's the order number?
ORD... hold on. 5582. KL9. Just... yeah.
Perfect, so I've got order ORD-5582-KL9 here and—oh interesting! Says here you ordered the Bluetooth speaker model BTS-400X. What'd you actually receive?
Some... headphones. Don't even know. Box says WH something.
WH! That's our, er, wireless headphone line. Let me see what... aha! Okay so basically what happened—this is actually kind of fascinating—your item got swapped at fulfillment center FC-7 in Memphis.
Great. So now what. I need the speaker. By Friday.
Right right, totally get it. Here's what I can do—and like, this is gonna work out great—I'm showing we have your BTS-400X speaker in stock at our distribution center just 18 miles from you.
Eighteen miles. Still gotta wait though.
Well here's the thing, uh, since this was our mistake? I'm authorizing same-day courier delivery. Should arrive by, hmm... system says 6:47 PM today.
Today? Actually today?
Yep! Driver code DC-890 will text you when they're 30 minutes out. Plus I'm issuing a return label—reference number RTN-7799823—for those headphones.
Oh. Okay that's... better. What about next time though.
So I'm actually, er, flagging your account with priority status code PS-GOLD. Basically means any future orders get double-checked at fulfillment. Won't happen again.
Double-checked. Sure. We'll see.
I know, I know—trust is earned. But look, your confirmation number for today's delivery is CNF-4421-QX. And my direct extension? It's 8847 if anything goes sideways.
Eight eight four seven. Got it. Thanks. I guess.
Oh! Almost forgot—those headphones you got by mistake? Model WH-750NC? They retail for 40 dollars more than your speaker. So, um, I'm adding a 40 dollar credit to your account.
Wait, credit? For real?
Absolutely! Credit code CRD-9982-V expires in 90 days. Should post within, like... checking... yeah, 2 to 3 business hours. Consider it an apology for the hassle.
